oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Corinne Bailey, 1982 February 14, excerpt 01
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Corinne Frazier Calhoun Bailey, conducted on 14 February 1982 by Ophelia Paine as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project. Bailey, who was the daughter of Tyler Calhoun, a Nashville jeweler, discusses her father's business and how it failed during the early 1920s. The complete interview is available in the repository.
